title: Add global high score leaderboard
description:
## Overview
Global high score leaderboard using Firebase Realtime Database with classic arcade-style 3-letter initials.

## Entry Data (Full Stats)
Each leaderboard entry displays:
- 3-letter initials (e.g., AAA, BOB)
- Score
- Wave reached
- Enemies killed
- Time survived

## Backend: Firebase
- Use Firebase Realtime Database
- Free tier sufficient for initial use
- Real-time sync across all players
- No server to maintain

## Display
- Top 10 scores only
- Shown on:
  - Main menu (view anytime)
  - Game over screen (with submission if qualified)
- Highlight player's rank if they made the board

## User Flow
1. Game over → Check if score qualifies for top 10
2. If qualified → Prompt for 3-letter initials input
3. Submit to Firebase → Show updated leaderboard with new entry highlighted
4. If not qualified → Show leaderboard with "Your score: X" displayed below

## Implementation Tasks
1. Set up Firebase project and configure credentials
2. Create LeaderboardService class for Firebase operations
3. Add initials input UI (3 characters, arcade style)
4. Create LeaderboardScene for displaying scores
5. Integrate with GameOverScene for score submission
6. Add leaderboard button to main menu
7. Track additional stats during gameplay (enemies killed, time)
close_reason: Implemented Firebase leaderboard with 3-letter initials, full stats display, top 10 ranking

title: Create VisualEffectsManager
description:
## Problem
Visual effects (flash, shake, explosion) scattered across codebase:
- Player.takeDamage() has flash tween
- Boss.takeDamage() has flash + screen shake
- Mine.explode() calls scene.playExplosion()
- CollisionManager calls scene.playExplosion()

Inconsistent feel, hard to adjust globally.

## Solution
Create centralized VisualEffectsManager:

```javascript
class VisualEffectsManager {
  damageFlash(target, color = 0xff0000) { ... }
  screenShake(intensity = 0.01, duration = 100) { ... }
  explosion(x, y, scale = 1) { ... }
  floatingText(x, y, text, color) { ... }
}
```

## Files to change
- src/systems/VisualEffectsManager.js (new)
- src/sprites/Player.js - use manager
- src/sprites/Boss.js - use manager
- src/sprites/Mine.js - use manager
- src/systems/CollisionManager.js - use manager

## Benefit
Consistent visual polish, one place to tune effects

title: Add Firebase security hardening
description:
## Overview
Harden Firebase leaderboard against spam/abuse.

## Options to implement

### 1. Domain restrictions (easy)
- Firebase Console → Project Settings → Authorized domains
- Restrict to: jesse-spevack.github.io, localhost

### 2. Rate limiting via rules (medium)
- Limit writes per IP/session using Firebase rules
- Prevent rapid-fire score submissions

### 3. Score validation (medium)
- Add server-side validation (Cloud Functions)
- Reject impossibly high scores
- Check score/wave/time ratios for plausibility

### 4. Authentication (more work)
- Require anonymous auth before submitting
- Tracks submissions per user
- Can ban abusive users

## Recommendation
Start with domain restrictions (5 min, no code). Add validation later if abuse occurs.

title: Standardize entity update patterns
description:
## Problem
Inconsistent update method patterns across entities:

| Entity | Update Method | Called By |
|--------|---------------|-----------|
| Player | `update()` | Scene calls manually |
| Enemy | `preUpdate()` | Phaser via runChildUpdate |
| Boss | `preUpdate()` | Phaser (manually added) |
| Mine | `preUpdate()` | Phaser via runChildUpdate |

This creates cognitive overhead and potential timing issues.

## Locations
- `src/sprites/Player.js` - uses `update()`
- `src/sprites/Enemy.js` - uses `preUpdate()`
- `src/sprites/Boss.js` - uses `preUpdate()`
- `src/sprites/Mine.js` - uses `preUpdate()`

## Solution
Standardize on `preUpdate()` pattern for all entities:
1. Move Player logic to `preUpdate(time, delta)`
2. Add Player to a group with `runChildUpdate: true`
3. Remove manual `this.player.update()` call from GameScene

## Acceptance
- All entities use preUpdate() consistently
- Player movement still works correctly
- No frame-delay issues with player input
close_reason: Converted Player to preUpdate pattern with playerGroup runChildUpdate

title: Add lifecycle cleanup to prevent memory leaks
description:
## Problem
Managers register event listeners but never clean them up:
- `BossManager` has `destroy()` method but it's never called
- `UIManager` has no cleanup method
- `CollisionManager` has no cleanup method
- Tweens in `Boss.js` can reference destroyed objects

## Locations
- `src/systems/BossManager.js:32-33` - registers listeners
- `src/systems/UIManager.js` - no destroy method
- `src/systems/CollisionManager.js` - no destroy method
- `src/sprites/Boss.js` - tweens reference `this.scene`

## Solution
1. Add `destroy()` methods to all managers:
```javascript
destroy() {
  this.scene.events.off('bossDefeated', this.onBossDefeated, this);
  this.scene.events.off('bossSummon', this.onBossSummon, this);
}
```

2. Call manager `destroy()` in `GameScene.shutdown()`:
```javascript
shutdown() {
  this.bossManager?.destroy();
  this.collisionManager?.destroy();
  this.uiManager?.destroy();
}
```

## Acceptance
- All managers have destroy() methods
- GameScene.shutdown() calls all cleanup
- No console errors during scene restart
close_reason: Added destroy() methods and shutdown() cleanup

title: Fix collision type detection for production builds
description:
## Problem
`CollisionManager.js` uses `constructor.name` to identify object types in collision callbacks:
```javascript
const bullet = obj1.constructor.name === 'Bullet' ? obj1 : obj2;
```

This **breaks in production** because minifiers rename classes (e.g., 'Bullet' becomes 'a').

## Location
- `src/systems/CollisionManager.js:188-191, 207-209`

## Solution
Replace with `instanceof` checks:
```javascript
bulletHitBoss(obj1, obj2) {
  const bullet = obj1 instanceof Bullet ? obj1 : obj2;
  const boss = obj1 instanceof Boss ? obj1 : obj2;
  // ...
}
```

Requires importing Bullet and Boss classes at top of file.

## Acceptance
- Build with `npm run build`
- Test in production build (`npm run preview`)
- Verify collisions still work after minification

title: Decouple CollisionManager from scene
description:
## Problem
CollisionManager directly calls scene methods:
- scene.loseLife()
- scene.playExplosion()
- scene.events.emit()

Tight coupling makes testing hard, changes risky.

## Solution
Make CollisionManager event-based only:

```javascript
// Instead of:
this.scene.loseLife();

// Emit event:
this.scene.events.emit('player:died');

// Scene handles:
this.events.on('player:died', () => this.loseLife());
```

## Files to change
- src/systems/CollisionManager.js - emit events only
- src/scenes/GameScene.js - handle all events

## Benefit
Managers are testable, reusable, decoupled
